entry.title: New release for Wiredoor: First Stable Release
entry.content:
Wiredoor First Stable Release

We‚Äôre proud to announce Wiredoor v1.0.0, the first official stable release of our open-source ingress-as-a-service platform.

What is Wiredoor?

Wiredoor securely exposes your private HTTP and TCP services without opening a single port on your firewall or router.

It works by establishing a reverse WireGuard tunnel from your internal system to public Wiredoor Server. Services are then securely published via NGINX, with full control over access, encryption, and routing.

Whether you‚Äôre running a homelab, a private Kubernetes cluster, or legacy infrastructure behind NAT, Wiredoor makes remote access simple, secure, and scalable.

Highlights

  • Expose private HTTP/TCP services with a single CLI command.
  • No port forwarding or NAT configuration required.
  • End-to-end encryption using WireGuard and NGINX.
  • Custom access control with --allow and --block rules.
  • Gateway mode for exposing entire clusters or networks.
  • Local node mode for exposing services on the Wiredoor server itself.
  • Real-time access logs per service or domain.

What's in v1.0.0?

  • wiredoor-server with Web UI and REST API
  • wiredoor-cli for connecting and exposing services
  • wiredoor-gateway Helm chart for Kubernetes
  • Support for both HTTP and TCP services
  • Support for multiple nodes per instance
  • Health checks and auto-reconnect daemon

Get Started

Follow the Quickstart guide:

üëâ https://www.wiredoor.net/docs/quickstart

ü§ù Contribute & Support

We‚Äôre just getting started.

You can help by:

  • ‚≠ê Starring the project
  • üêõ Reporting bugs
  • ‚úçÔ∏è Improving the docs
  • üí¨ Sharing how you use Wiredoor

Join the conversation:

üëâ GitHub Discussions

Thanks for being part of the journey ‚Äî let‚Äôs build secure infrastructure access for everyone. ‚Äî The Wiredoor Team

entry.title: New release for Wiredoor: v1.0.1
entry.content:
What's Changed

  • fix: change wiredoor backendHost from localhost to 127.0.0.1 by @dmesad in https://github.com/wiredoor/wiredoor/pull/24

Full Changelog: https://github.com/wiredoor/wiredoor/compare/v1.0.0...v1.0.1

entry.title: New release for Wiredoor: v1.0.2
